summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys and a legal assistant at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, discussing flight logs in preparation for depositions. The emails focus on identifying an unnamed individual who appears on flight logs with Jeffrey Epstein and was photographed leaving his New York apartment.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: She is the sender of the main email, asking if the recipient recognizes an unnamed individual from a photo, as part of reviewing flight logs for upcoming depositions.

persons.name: Aneisha Christie
persons.role: Legal Assistant at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: She forwarded an article from the Daily Mail and flight log information, noting the unnamed individual was on flight logs multiple times, including on flight #1919 with Epstein.

connections.description: They are both part of the legal team at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, with McCawley as a partner and Christie as a legal assistant, collaborating on case preparation.

events.title: Email exchange reviewing flight logs
events.description: Attorneys at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP exchange emails to review flight logs and identify an unnamed individual photographed leaving Epstein's New York apartment, in preparation for upcoming depositions.

keyFacts: Flight logs were being reviewed by attorneys in preparation for upcoming depositions related to the Epstein case.
An unnamed individual was identified on flight logs multiple times, including on flight #1919 with Jeffrey Epstein.
The same unnamed individual was photographed coming out of Epstein's New York apartment.
The information was sourced from a Daily Mail article forwarded by a legal assistant.
The correspondence highlights the legal team's investigative efforts to identify and connect individuals to Epstein through travel records and photographic evidence.
